See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import unittest import mock from tempest.tests import base class ConfCounter(object): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): self.count = 0 def __getattr__(self, key): self.count += 1 return mock.MagicMock() def get_counts(self): return self.count class TestImports(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestImports, self).setUp() self.conf_mock = self.patch('tempest.config.CONF', new_callable=ConfCounter) def _check_mock(self): calls = self.conf_mock.mock_calls print(calls) def test_account_generator_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import account_generator # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_cleanup_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import cleanup # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_init_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import init # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_list_plugins_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import list_plugins # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_run_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import run # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_subunit_descibe_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import subunit_describe_calls # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_verify_tempest_config_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import verify_tempest_config # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_workspace_command_import(self): from tempest.cmd import workspace # noqa self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts()) def test_tempest_test_discovery(self): test_path = os.path.join( os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))), 'test_discover') unittest.TestLoader().discover(test_path) self.assertEqual(0, self.conf_mock.get_counts())

subject: Only filter/weigh hosts once if scheduling a single instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-21 13:34:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9186dbfcd49bf3fb4ffddee015ce811aabe775c0', 'message': "Only filter/weigh hosts once if scheduling a single instance

If we're only scheduling for a single instance, we don't need
filter and weigh hosts another time before picking alternates
because the single selected host for the single instance can't
be in the list of filtered/weighed alternates anyway.

This helps avoid an unnecessary performance penalty for finding
alternates when we just have a single instance - which is likely
the majority of cases.

Change-Id: Ie065c4e169db4e02fbfa8ccadb0af23d2784cab8
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-21 13:43:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fb8109fc920a0993746656253bf40d0c61c2ac45', 'message': "Only filter/weigh hosts once if scheduling a single instance

If we're only scheduling for a single instance, we don't need
filter and weigh hosts another time before picking alternates
because the single selected host for the single instance can't

commit_message:
Only filter/weigh hosts once if scheduling a single instance

If we're only scheduling for a single instance, we don't need
filter and weigh hosts another time before picking alternates
because the single selected host for the single instance can't
be in the list of filtered/weighed alternates anyway.

This helps avoid an unnecessary performance penalty for finding
alternates when we just have a single instance - which is likely
the majority of cases.

Change-Id: Ie065c4e169db4e02fbfa8ccadb0af23d2784cab8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/513931/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Filtering and weighing hosts should be called num_instances + 1 times # unless num_instances == 1. self.assertEqual(num_instances + 1 if num_instances > 1 else 1, mock_sorted.call_count, 'Unexpected number of calls to filter hosts for %s ' 'instances.' % num_instances)

commit_message:
Have create_pending_row return the entry

This change is needed in order to be able to print the entry's ID to the
log once it's created, in order to have better debug-ability of the logs
(we'll be able to correlate entries better if we know the ID and not
only the object ID which can have multiple entries).

A follow up patch makes use of this ability.

Change-Id: I8eb82a5e5c0124c1eaf5fb3cbf32e12fd169e7ff
Related-Bug: #1713487
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/54/514354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix extension unit test after neutron change

Neutron Change I2586f0b11b107d7f57214a0d65bcf7c38a5f0ebb changed the
signature of _setUpExtension.

This updates unit tests to follow this change.

Closes-Bug: 1727988

Change-Id: I0b2bc3abf8c68f76beb9554207968978d13222dc
